thread.title: How Much Can Top Auto Parts Store Profits Accelerate?

title: How Much Can Top Auto Parts Store Profits Accelerate?
text:
UBS Leads More Banking Stocks To New Highs 
Banking stocks continue to gain upward momentum, and Thursday's action proved no exception. UBS Group (NYSE:UBS) climbed 0.17 to 22.99 in pale volume. On a weekly basis, the stock is poised to make its best close in at least four years. The Swiss bank saw flat revenue in the second quarter at $10.4 ... 07/30/2015 07:00 PM ET Stocks Open Lower, Volume Rises; Skechers, Wynn Resorts Rumble Ahead 
Stocks slumped out of the starting gate Thursday, with a weaker-than-expected GDP estimate and earnings news crimping early action. The Nasdaq shed 0.4%. So did the Dow Jones industrial average and the S&P 500. Small caps were under some additional pressure, with the Russell 2000 down 0.6%. ... 07/30/2015 10:38 AM ET 
O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) reported better-than-expected earnings growth late Wednesday and raised full-year guidance, sending the auto parts retailer's stock higher in after-hours action. O'Reilly earned $2.32 a share, up 21.5% vs. a year earlier and the 18th straight quarter of ... 07/29/2015 07:18 PM ET O'Reilly Zooms Past Estimates 
4 The auto-parts retailer grew Q2 EPS nearly 20% to $2.29, beating estimates by 3 cents as same-store sales surged 7.2%. O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) cited 15% or higher EPS growth 26 quarters in a row. Sales grew 22.4% to $2.26 bil, topping views for $2 bil. Shares rose in extended trading ... 07/29/2015 06:50 PM ET Did O'Reilly Automotive Operate In High Gear In Q2 
Did O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) put the pedal to the metal and accelerate earnings growth in the second quarter? If analysts are right, the specialty retailer of aftermarket auto parts ran into a bit of a speed bump during the quarter, as it faced tough comparisons. O'Reilly has racked up 15 ... 07/27/2015 08:02 AM ET 1% Q2 Profit Growth Is S&P 500's Weakest Since '12 
Just six companies are keeping second-quarter earnings growth in positive territory for S&P 500 businesses, which may suggest more softness to come. With 72% of S&P 500 companies having reported their performance in the last calendar quarter, earnings have grown a mere 0.9%. Revenue so far ... 07/31/2015 05:47 PM ET Semper Fly: Marines Say Lockheed F-35B Combat Ready 
The Marine Corps version of Lockheed Martin's (NYSE:LMT) F-35 is now ready for combat, after receiving initial operational capability (IOC) status on Friday. The F-35B is the first version of the overbudget and behind-schedule stealth jet to reach IOC after a five-day operational readiness ... 07/31/2015 05:45 PM ET Beverage Companies Face Watered-Down Industry Trends 
Anyone searching for insight into the state of the nonalcoholic beverage industry should take a gander at last month's earnings from Coca-Cola, the global soft-drink giant that finds itself awash in challenges. On the bright side, Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) beat consensus earnings and sales estimates when ... 07/31/2015 04:43 PM ET Exxon Profit Drops 51%, Chevron 90% On Low Oil Prices 
ExxonMobil (NYSE:XOM) and Chevron (NYSE:CVX) reported mixed second-quarter results Friday as oil prices stayed down nearly 50% from a year ago. Exxon's Q2 earnings fell 51% to $1 per share, less than the $1.11 per share that analysts polled by Thomson Reuters were expecting. Revenue fell 33.6% to ... 07/31/2015 04:26 PM ET Valeant Missed Out On Botox But Hits With Other Buys 
If not for acquisitions, Valeant Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:VRX) would hardly make it on a map of large and fast-growing drug companies. But not only has it earned a spot on such a map, it is all over the map. It sells everything from cancer and neurology drugs to cold remedies and toenail fungal ... 07/31/2015 04:03 PM ET
